definition: working couple (husband and wife both employed)

sentences.english: They were all dual-earner couples -- both husband and wife held full-time jobs.
sentences.chinese: 研究对象都是双职工，即夫妇二人都有全职工作。

sentences.english: In double-career families children are often neglected.
sentences.chinese: 在“双职工”家庭，孩子经常被忽略。

sentences.english: Health experts are predicting severe strains on the state and on working families here.
sentences.chinese: 健康专家预期国家和双职工家庭将面临巨大的压力。

sentences.english: Convenience dishes are very welcome to the families of working couples.
sentences.chinese: 烹制简便的莱肴，深受双职工家庭的欢迎。

sentences.english: My family is a two-career family with both my parents working.
sentences.chinese: 我父母都工作，所以我家是“双职工”家庭。

sentences.english: Both one- and two-income households probably need more.
sentences.chinese: 单职工和双职工家庭都可能需要更多的保险。

sentences.english: So what do working families eat?
sentences.chinese: 那么双职工家庭吃什么呢？

definition: to buy a house on a mortgage/house mortgage
to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas/to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together
to go to school/to attend school
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
lit. above are the elderly, below are the young (idiom)/fig. to have to take care of both one's aging parents and one's children/sandwich generation
pinyin: shang4 you3 lao3 xia4 you3 xiao3
